channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Passengers on crashed Toronto plane offered US$30,000 each
item.description: The gesture to the affected travellers - all of whom survived - comes with no strings attached, the airline says.

item.title: Justice Department official urges quick dismissal of criminal case against New York City mayor
Israel's 'hearts lie in tatters' as Hamas hands over first dead hostages
item.description: They are believed to include the Bibas family, who for Israel have become a symbol of the captives.

item.title: Zelenskyy meets U.S. envoy to Ukraine and Russia after Trump calls him a dictator
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has met with the U.S. envoy to Ukraine and Russia a day after President Trump called him a dictator. CBS News ...

item.title: Children routinely using social media, Australian regulator says
item.description: It found they were easily able to bypass age checks on apps, which face being banned for under-16s.

item.title: The white man who pleaded guilty to shooting a Black teen who rang a wrong doorbell dies

item.title: A gold-framed Trump mug shot is hanging just outside the Oval Office
item.description: President Trump's mug shot is one of the first things visitors will see when approaching the Oval Office.

item.title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

item.title: Breakfast snack packs sold at Kroger, Meijer stores in 13 states recalled
item.description: The recall involves "Berry Buddies, Berries & Pancakes" packs that contain undeclared wheat and eggs, posing a risk for those with allergies.

item.title: BBC faces questions over Gaza film's Hamas link
item.description: The documentary Gaza: How To Survive A War Zone was narrated by the son of a Hamas official.

item.title: How Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum could hit you at the grocery store
item.description: U.S. tariffs could cause the prices of steel and aluminum cans to rise, an increase that may ultimately be passed on to consumers.
